primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Master (Christ) has established a household (Church) and departed, leaving a mandate of vigilance. The Church must remain awake in a dark world to recognize and receive the Master who returns both in the 'guise of the stranger' and in final glory.

tekstueel_bewijs: He is the one who gathered its members and assigned a place to each.
It is he who put the whole operation in motion.
The Lord came to me in a most unexpected guise.
Keep awake, then, for you do not know when the master of the house is coming.
He has ordered the door-keeper to stay awake.
Emmanuel shall come to thee, O Israel.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: He has promised us his presence in the sacrament of communion.
I presented the sandwich... with a profound sense of having been rescued.
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (The One who comes) and Helper (The One who feeds).

tekstueel_bewijs: The season of the shadows, the season of 'the works of darkness'.
The church in America is soon going to be having a major crisis of identity.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the 'head-on collision' between the Kingdom and the powers of darkness.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer (S) attempts to do charity (O) but is corrected by the Master (H) appearing as the poor (Opponent to pride).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Preacher/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is subverted by the primary program (grace) to show that even our 'doing' is a form of 'receiving'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Master → Returning to His House

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus Christ has come; Jesus Christ will come.
The Lord came to me in a most unexpected guise.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I decided to buy a nice sandwich.

voorbeelden: He must not find you asleep.
The church may not lock its doors.
I decided to buy a nice sandwich.
Fewer and fewer people know what the rules are.
Having been fed and upheld by the One Who Comes.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: While the 'Devoir' (must) is present in the mandate to watch, the sermon concludes that the 'Pouvoir' (ability) to watch comes entirely from being fed by the Master in the Sacrament.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the Absence (S2) of God in the heart, through the Sleep (Not-S1) of the American church, toward the Vigilance (Not-S2) of the doorkeeper, ending in the Presence (S1) of the Sacrament.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension of the Master's absence is resolved by His hidden presence in the 'stranger' and the 'sacrament'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely serious; described as a 'head-on collision' and 'life-threatening anxiety'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Even when it issues commands (stay awake), it identifies the Master as the one who initiates, sustains, and even 'rescues' the believer from their own attempts at morality.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the sandwich story
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I decided to buy a nice sandwich... for one of the derelict people.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord came to me... I was abashed and ashamed.
Together we receive his very self for this Advent life.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher uses herself as an example of failure/sleep rather than a model of virtue.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The Doorkeeper (as a functional role, not a moral hero)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The doorkeeper is not a hero of stamina but one who is 'upheld by the One Who Comes'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment through the sacrament rather than exhaustion from the 'must'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is a gift of the Master's presence, not a human achievement.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the crisis of the modern church with the biblical parable and the personal anecdote.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Master is away' and 'The Master is here'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The kingdom of God is in head-on collision with the powers of darkness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sacrament provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) to remain at the post.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'darkness' and 'sleep'—a state of being rather than just bad choices.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by the Master's movement toward the Church, not the Church's movement toward the Master.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current resolution where Pouvoir (Can) is gifted.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The transition to the Sacrament is the key 'grace-turn'.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is already sufficiently 'heavy' to require a divine Subject.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics that uses the 'Law' of the mandate to watch to drive the hearer to the 'Grace' of the Sacrament.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Grand Central' imagery, Greimas reveals that the 'stranger' in the story is actually the Subject (Master) in disguise.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Moves beyond the historical context of Mark 13 to the universal actantial roles of Master and Servant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Exposes that the preacher's 'good deed' was actually a 'performance' where she tried to be the Sender, but was rightfully demoted to Receiver by the 'Opponent' (the derelict's refusal).

volledige_subject_lijst: The Master (established, gave, gathered, assigned, put in motion, comes)
The Church (hears, repeats, lives, takes a beating, stays awake)
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's own criteria perfectly by making God the primary actor in the 'Advent' of the world.
